intro: Carex baiposhanensis, commonly known as the Baiposhan sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Sichuan and Yunnan provinces. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Carex baiposhanensis is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
